intro: Tenoria undulata, commonly known as the undulating tenoria, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive wavy edge, contributing to its common name. Tenoria undulata is adapted to harsh mountain environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
